block.p: Anne Carey Hambleton and David Walworth Starr were married yesterday at the Pot and Kettle, a club in Hull's Cove, Me. The Rev. Charlene S. Alling, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony.

Ms. Hambleton, 37, is keeping her name. She is a director of business development for Ecos Technologies, a New York company that provides environmental information on the Internet. She graduated from Middlebury College and received a master's degree in international relations from Johns Hopkins University. She is the daughter of George B. E. Hambleton of Mendham, N.J., and the late Janet Maclaren Hambleton. Her father retired as the director of commercial sales at Pan American World Airways in New York. He is also a founder of Project Orbis, an eye hospital aboard a jet, whose volunteer staff provides treatment and medical education in underdeveloped countries. The bride's grandfather John A. Hambleton was a founder of Pan American World Airways.
Anne Carey Hambleton and David Walworth Starr were married yesterday at the Pot and Kettle, a club in Hull's Cove, Me. The Rev. Charlene S. Alling, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony.

Ms. Hambleton, 37, is keeping her name. She is a director of business development for Ecos Technologies, a New York company that provides environmental information on the Internet. She graduated from Middlebury College and received a master's degree in international relations from Johns Hopkins University. She is the daughter of George B. E. Hambleton of Mendham, N.J., and the late Janet Maclaren Hambleton. Her father retired as the director of commercial sales at Pan American World Airways in New York. He is also a founder of Project Orbis, an eye hospital aboard a jet, whose volunteer staff provides treatment and medical education in underdeveloped countries. The bride's grandfather John A. Hambleton was a founder of Pan American World Airways.

Mr. Starr, 43, is a senior vice president and a portfolio manager at the Dwight Asset Management Company in Burlington, Vt. He graduated from Duke University, and is a son of Barbara and Edward H. Starr of Burlington. His father retired as the owner of the Ben Franklin stores in the Burlington area.
The bridegroom's previous marriage ended in divorce.
